content.description: Start 10' left of Demonstrator climbing the steep brown face past two bolts to a ledge. Two more bolts on the next steep brown face with crimpy holds lead to a crack out of a triangle shaped pocket. The crux is between bolts three and four. Also, the bolts are solid but they have Leeper hangers which shouldn't be trusted and need to be replaced. Belay with gear. Descend by hiking right to the top of the Chuckwalla Coulior and back down or go left and drop straight into the wash.
content.location: On the right end of the 80' Wall, just left of Demonstrator.

climbs.name: Son of Demonstrator
climbs.fa: Joe Herbst, Betsy Herbst, Matt McMackin 1973

content.description: Halfway between Demnostrator and the corner is a thin crack/seam that neither reaches the ground or the top. The crux is at the bulge just before the top and consists mainly of committing to the runout and resisting stepping left onto Demonstrator.
content.protection: Smaller cams and stoppers, brass nuts
content.location: The rightmost climb on the Demonstrator Wall.

content.description: Same start as Shake Your Bag of Bones. At the second bolt, go left across the smooth  face past three more. Bring a cam for a 3/8-1/2" wide pocket ten feet past the last bolt or run it out to the top.
content.location: Same start as Shake Your Bag of Bones.

content.description: Start in the middle of the wall, right where a small hidden chimney forms. Three bolts take you to the base of the small arete that comes down from the top. Stay on the slightly overhanging arete and left of the easy ledge for 11a, or go right past the bulge (a #1 camalot can be placed here and keeps the climb to 10b) to the ledge and then step left onto the arete to finish.
content.location: Start in the middle of the Demonstrator Ledge bellow a shallow arete/corner that comes halfway down the cliff.

content.description: Climb the dark wide crack at the very left side of the Demonstrator Ledge.

climbs.name: Demonstrator
climbs.fa: Joe and Betsy Herbst or the Sierra Club

content.description: On the right side of the Demonstrator wall, climb a striking thin to wide crack 10' left of the corner. This is an excellent climb and has many face holds.
content.location: The crack on the right side of Demonstrator Wall.

content.description:
Demonstrator Wall is the clean brown face high on the left before the first waterfall. It goes from the corner on the right to a crack on the left which divides this wall from Snake Eyes. All climbs are accessed from the Demonstrator Ledge which runs the length of the cliff and all climbs use gear for anchors.

 Edited for historical accuracy: Demonstrator Wall is the correct name for this cliff. The name "80 Foot Wall" was added by later climbers.
